Tidy data set description
========================================================
### Introduction

#### The tidy dataset generated by the run_analysis.R script contains 180 records across 69 variables.

* subject.id: The unique identifier for the subject partcipating in this study
* activity.id: The numeric identifier for the physical activity  
* activity.label: Descriptive name for the physical activity id
* 66 measurement variables: Mean (mean) and Standard Deviation (std) related variables  
  that were retained from the original list of 561 variables available in the raw data 
  files. The 't' prefix refers to time and the 'f' prefix stands for frequency based 
  measurements. X,Y,Z correspond to the appropriate measurement axis-coordinate.
  
  Each row in the data set represents a subject's average of a mean-related measurement or an average of a 
  standard-deviation measurement for a specific activity. Each one of the 30 subjects has an aggregated 
  record for all the 66 features, for each of the 6 activities.
  
* * *
### Transformation Steps

#### The R script performs the following cleanup and transformation steps on the raw motion data in the UCI HAR Dataset directory (directory created after unarchiving the zipped data file)

#### * Merges the training and the test sets to create one data set with 10299 observations
#### * Extracts only the measurements on the mean and standard deviation for each measurement (66 features retained). 
#### * Uses descriptive activity names to name the activities in the data set.
#### * Appropriately labels the data set with user-friendly names.
#### * Creates a second, independent tidy data set with the average of each variable for each activity and  each subject (Groups the dataset by subject and activity label and calculates the mean across all 66 variables).
#### * Writes the tidy data set to a tab-delimited data file (tidydata.txt).

####   Please refer to the inline code comments for additional details
  
* * *
### Data Variables
  
#### A listing of all variables in the data set is provided below

```{r}
|    | variable.names            |
|----|---------------------------|
| 1  | subject.id                |
```
